intro: Siphocampylus foliosus var. subcanus, commonly known as the silverleaf siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it forms dense, low-growing mats.
